title: Effective Tax Strategies: Maximizing Retirement Contributions to Minimize Taxable Income
subtitle: Discover how making strategic retirement contributions can significantly reduce your taxable income and help you save on taxes. Learn about the benefits of 401k, IRA, HSA, and more.
content:
Tyler? Yep.

Looks like you made $88,000 of income in 2023?

Yep.

So you owe us?

Oh, no. I put $22,500 of that into my 401k. Sorry, make that $30,000 because I'm over 50.

$15,500 of that went to my simple IRA.

$7,500 of that to my traditional IRA.

$7,750 into my HSA.

$3,050 into my FSA.

So that only leaves you with $24,200 of taxable income?

Oh, that was actually long-term capital gains that you can't touch because my wife and I make under $89,250.

So you owe us?

Nothing.
